page.title: 01The Hills North of Langholm
page.content: This area is mostly moorland with Ewes River Valley in west. The A7 Edinburgh -Carlisle road runs through. Monument to Hugh Macdiarmid the Scottish poet was unveiled 11.08.1985 on Whita Hill adjacent to the narrow road from the A7 to Newcastleton. A sawmill worked by Buccleuch Estates provides gates & fence posts for farms in the area. The Scottish Episcopal church uses the chapel inside the grounds of Langholm Lodge. The Blue Riband Race of the Border Hound Trail Association is run over 10 miles on the hills either side of the valley. Peat is cut from the moors by Langholm families. Farming is mainly sheep and hill cattle, the fields are used to grow food for the animals. Rugby Union is played on Milntown every week Sept.-May. Whitshiels Cafe provides overnight caravan parking & B&B for tourists.
